weatherForecast.comment: On Wednesday, high-pressure front conditions over the Alps. Brilliantly sunny, cloudless skies, outstanding visibility. Light southerly winds. At 2000m: +4 degrees; at 1000m: up to +11 degrees. Source: GeoSphere Austria

avalancheActivity.highlights: Caution: wet loose-snow avalanches on very steep sunny slopes; weak layers in old snow
avalancheActivity.comment: Due to daytime warming and solar radiation, increasingly frequent generally small-sized wet loose-snow avalanches are possible, esp. on extremely steep sunny slopes. Avalanches are triggerable by persons in the weak old snow, esp. on W/N/E facng slopes above 1800m, releases sometimes medium-sized.

snowpackStructure.comment: Sunny slopes: Due to low temperatures and low air moisture, a surface crust forms during the nocturnal hours. Solar radiation and daytime warmth lead to significantly moister snowpack, esp. on extremely steep slopes. Shady slopes: inside the snowpack are expansively metamorphosed (faceted) weak layers, esp on W/N/E facing slopes above 1800m. The old snowpack is expansively metamorphosed (faceted) on the surface.

weatherForecast.comment: On Wednesday, high-pressure front conditions over the Alps. Brilliantly sunny, cloudless skies, outstanding visibility. Light southerly winds. At 2000m: +4 degrees; at 1000m: up to +11 degrees. Source: GeoSphere Austria

avalancheActivity.highlights: Caution: weak layers in old snow.
avalancheActivity.comment: Due to daytime warming and solar radiation, increasingly frequent generally small-sized wet loose-snow avalanches are possible, esp. on extremely steep sunny slopes above 2800m. Avalanches are triggerable by persons in the weak old snow, esp. on W/N/E facng slopes above 2200m, releases sometimes medium-sized, esp. on very steep shady slopes and in transitions from shallow to deeper snow, e.g. at entry points into gullies and bowls.

snowpackStructure.comment: Sunny slopes: Due to low temperatures and low air moisture, a surface crust forms during the nocturnal hours. Solar radiation and daytime warmth lead to significantly moister snowpack, esp. on extremely steep slopes. Shady slopes: inside the snowpack are expansively metamorphosed (faceted) weak layers, esp on W/N/E facing slopes above 1800m. The old snowpack is expansively metamorphosed (faceted) on the surface.

tendency.highlights: Wet loose-snow avalanches can trigger in starting zones which have not yet discharged

weatherForecast.comment: On Wednesday, high-pressure front conditions over the Alps. Brilliantly sunny, cloudless skies, outstanding visibility. Light southerly winds. At 2000m: +4 degrees; at 1000m: up to +11 degrees. Source: GeoSphere Austria

avalancheActivity.highlights: Caution: loose-snow avalanches on extremely steep sunny slopes
avalancheActivity.comment: Due to solar radiation, increasingly frequent generally small-sized wet loose-snow avalanches are anticipated, esp. on extremely steep sunny slopes. Avalanches are triggerable by persons esp. by large addtional loading on NW/N/NE facing slopes above 2000m, releases mostly small.

snowpackStructure.comment: Sunny slopes: Due to low temperatures and low air moisture, a surface crust forms during the nocturnal hours. Solar radiation and daytime warmth lead to significantly moister snowpack, esp. on extremely steep slopes. Shady slopes: inside the snowpack are expansively metamorphosed (faceted) weak layers, esp on W/N/E facing slopes above 1800m. The old snowpack is expansively metamorphosed (faceted) on the surface.

customData.generalHeadline: Generally favorable conditions in morning, then danger of wet loose-snow avalanches rising. Beware weak layers in old snowpack.
